Therefore we ought to give the more earnest heed to the things which we have heard, lest at any time we should let <FI>them<Fi> slip.<RF>let…: Gr. run out as leaking vessels<Rf>
For if the word spoken by angels was stedfast, and every transgression and disobedience received a just recompence of reward;
How shall we escape, if we neglect so great salvation; which at the first began to be spoken by the Lord, and was confirmed unto us by them that heard <FI>him<Fi>;
God also bearing <FI>them<Fi> witness, both with signs and wonders, and with divers miracles, and gifts of the Holy Ghost, according to his own will?<RF>gifts: or, distributions<Rf><CM>
For unto the angels hath he not put in subjection the world to come, whereof we speak.
But one in a certain place testified, saying, <FO>What is man, that thou art mindful of him? or the son of man, that thou visitest him?<Fo>
<FO>Thou madest him a little lower than the angels; thou crownedst him with glory and honour, and didst set him over the works of thy hands:<Fo><RF>lower…: or, while inferior to<Rf>

<FO>Thou hast put all things in subjection under his feet.<Fo> For in that he put all in subjection under him, he left nothing <FI>that is<Fi> not put under him. But now we see not yet all things put under him.

But we see Jesus, who was made a little lower than the angels for the suffering of death, crowned with glory and honour; that he by the grace of God should taste death for every man.<RF>for the: or, by the<Rf><CM>
For it became him, for whom <FI>are<Fi> all things, and by whom <FI>are<Fi> all things, in bringing many sons unto glory, to make the captain of their salvation perfect through sufferings.
For both he that sanctifieth and they who are sanctified <FI>are<Fi> all of one: for which cause he is not ashamed to call them brethren,
Saying, <FO>I will declare thy name unto my brethren, in the midst of the church will I sing praise unto thee.<Fo>
And again, <FO>I will put my trust in him. And again, Behold I and the children which God hath given me.<Fo><CM>

Forasmuch then as the children are partakers of flesh and blood, he also himself likewise took part of the same; that through death he might destroy him that had the power of death, that is, the devil;
And deliver them who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage.
For verily he took not on <FI>him the nature of<Fi> angels; but he took on <FI>him<Fi> the seed of Abraham.<RF>took not…: Gr. taketh not hold of angels, but of the seed of Abraham he taketh hold<Rf>

Wherefore in all things it behoved him to be made like unto <FI>his<Fi> brethren, that he might be a merciful and faithful high priest in things <FI>pertaining<Fi> to God, to make reconciliation for the sins of the people.
For in that he himself hath suffered being tempted, he is able to succour them that are tempted.<CM>
